byline.contributor: Sarah Maslin Nir contributed reporting from New York. Doris Burke contributed research.

abstract: Fire departments across country, prompted by deadly fire in  Oakland, Calif, are investigating and often evicting people from illegally occupied warehouses that serve as underground arts and event spaces; tenants acknowledge risks of living in such spaces and many are attempting to fix problems without drawing attention of authorities.

headline.print_headline: Oakland Fire Leads Cities to Scrutinize Artists’ Spaces
headline.main: Oakland Fire Leads to Crackdown on Illegal Warehouses Nationwide

snippet: Event spaces have been scrutinized or shut down in Nashville, Philadelphia, Austin and elsewhere since a warehouse fire in Oakland killed 36 people....
lead_paragraph: Event spaces have been scrutinized or shut down in Nashville, Philadelphia, Austin and elsewhere since a warehouse fire in Oakland killed 36 people.
